text: New Zealand Maths Olympiad Committee 2009 Maths Gymnastics Christchurch, Thursday 14 January 1. Simplify sin 4 x + cos4 x − 1 sin 6 x + cos6 x − 1 2. Find all integers n ≥ 2 such that 3n2 − 3n + 20 n − 1 is a positive integer. 3. Find the value of 1 sin 10◦ − √3 cos 10◦ 4. Find all real numbers x such that 4√8 − x + 4√89 + x = 5. 5. Find the value of tan x 2 , if sin x − cos x = 1.4. 6. Solve the following inequality sin 2x − cos 2x + 1 sin 2x + cos 2x + 1 > 0. 7. What is the value of 8 cos 4π 9 cos 2π 9 cos π 9 ? 8. I am thinking of a positive integer x. • When you divide x by 2, the remainder is 1. • When you divide x by 3, the remainder is 2. • When you divide x by 4, the remainder is 3. • When you divide x by 5, the remainder is 4. What are the possible values for my integer x? 9. Simplify: cos x + cos 2x + cos 3x + · · · + cos 100x 10. The longest median of a right-angled triangle has length 8. What is the length of the hy- potenuse? 11. Prove that for all triplets (a, b, c) of positive real numbers, ab(a + b − 2c) + bc(b + c − 2a) + ac(a + c − 2b) ≥ 0. 12. A cyclic quadrilateral has side lengths 1, 5, 5 and 7. What is its area? 13. Suppose tan x 2 = a b Prove that a sin x + b cos x does not depend on x.
